title.narrative: F.a: Human rights risks and trade unions in Kesko Corporation's supply chain

description.narrative: In the project will be carried out a survey to employees of Kesko's risk countries sub-contracting companies about Kesko's purchasing practices, their possible risks to labor and human rights and practical proposals to improve the social responsibility of procurement. For quite some time Corporate responsibility has longed for clear international rules, so the UN Human Rights Council adopted the UN Guiding Principles is the Business and Human Rights- principles in 2011. The principles govern states and comp anies: States have an obligation to protect people from human rights violations caused by businesses by regulating the activities of companies by law. In addition, they must ensure that human rights violators are held accountable and the victims receive ef fective help and support. Companies are in turn responsible for respecting human rights and they must also avoid their own actions causing human rights violations or contributing to them.The project will provide information on Kesko's subcontractor factori es working conditions and responsibility Kesko's supply chain. The project will benefit the unions involved in the supply chain, and they can make use of research results in their negotiations with the employer. With the help of the research Kesko obtain m ore information on its supply chain functionality and transparency and SASK is able to evaluate accountability of Kesko’s procurement practices from the perspective of the UN guiding principles of the Business and Human Rights. Research is carried out wi th long-term project partners of SASK in the Philippines, and China, as well as with the assistance of external researchers in India and Bangladesh.
